prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Flat Bottom Step 1: Create a New Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Step 2: Create the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Draw the Circle Draw a circle on face_1 of the sketch with its center at (0.25, 0.25) and radius 0.25. This creates loop_1 and face_1 in the sketch. Step 4: Scale the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Step 5: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units. Use the operation "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create a new solid body as the first intermediate part. The height of this part is approximately three times its diameter, and the top of the cylinder is slightly wider than the bottom. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End Step 1: Create a New Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system by setting the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and Translation Vector to (0.175, 0.175, 0.75). Step 2: Create the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the second coordinate system. Step 3: Draw the Circle Draw a circle on face_1 of the sketch with its center at (0.075, 0.075) and radius 0.075. This creates loop_1 and face_1 in the sketch. Step 4: Scale the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.15 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Step 5: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the second coordinate system. Step 6: Perform the Cut Feature Operation Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by a depth of 0.0 units towards the normal and a depth of 0.5 units in the opposite direction. Use the operation "CutFeatureOperation" to create a cut in the previously constructed CAD part, thereby forming a tapered end for the second intermediate part, which resembles a metallic tube. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The top is wider than the bottom, and the object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a solid material. The height of the final shape is slightly larger than three times its diameter, and the top and bottom are tapered.</description>

<description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0375, 0.75, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a rectangle on face_1 with the following vertices: - (0.0, 0.0) - (0.6208, 0.0) - (0.6208, 0.2292) - (0.0, 0.2292) This rectangle consists of 4 lines and 1 loop. Extrude the sketched rectangle to a depth of 0.75 towards the normal. Scale the sketch by 0.6208. Perform a "New Body Feature Operation". Part 2 Instructions Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0208, 0.0, 0.0]. In the sketch for face_1, draw a rectangle formed by the following points: - (0.0, 0.0) - (0.0167, 0.0) - (0.0167, 0.2292) - (0.6375, 0.2292) - (0.6375, 0.0) - (0.6544, 0.0) - (0.6544, 0.2667) - (0.0, 0.2667) Close this sketch by connecting the last point to the first point. This sketch contains 8 lines and 1 loop. Extrude the sketched shape with no depth towards the normal directions. Scale by a factor of 0.6544. Perform a "Join Feature Operation". Part 3 Instructions Create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Create a new coordinate system at the specified location with Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a circle on face_1 centered at (0.2083, 0.2083) with a radius of 0.2083. Extrude the sketched circle with no depth towards the normal direction and extend it by 0.1667 in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by 0.4167. Perform a "Cut Feature Operation".</description>

<description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and zero translation. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane, with the following loops and curves: 1. **Loop 1:** - Arc 1: Starting at (0, 0.015), ending at (0.015, 0) with a midpoint at (0.0044, 0.0044). - Line 1: Starting at (0.015, 0), ending at (0.735, 0). - Arc 2: Starting at (0.735, 0), ending at (0.75, 0.015) with a midpoint at (0.7456, 0.0044). - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.015), ending at (0.75, 0.51). - Arc 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.51), ending at (0.735, 0.525) with a midpoint at (0.7456, 0.5206). - Line 3: Starting at (0.735, 0.525), ending at (0.015, 0.525). - Arc 4: Starting at (0.015, 0.525), ending at (0, 0.51) with a midpoint at (0.0044, 0.5206). - Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.51), ending at (0, 0.015). Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch by 75% Apply a uniform scale transformation of 0.75 to the 2D sketch to adjust the dimensions using the sketch_scale parameter. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Define a coordinate system transformation with the euler angles and translation vector provided: - Euler angles: (0, 0, 0) - Translation vector: (0, 0, 0) Apply this transformation to the scaled 2D sketch, resulting in a 3D sketch. Step 5: Extrude the 3D sketch Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by 0.09 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the height is half the length of the sides. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Set up a coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler angles: (0, 0, 0) - Translation vector: (0.015, 0.015, 0) Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane, with the following loop and curves: 1. **Loop 1:** - Line 1: Starting at (0, 0), ending at (0.72, 0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.72, 0), ending at (0.72, 0.495) - Line 3: Starting at (0.72, 0.495), ending at (0, 0.495) - Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.495), ending at (0, 0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Apply a uniform scale transformation of 0.72 to the 2D sketch to adjust the dimensions based on the sketch_scale parameter. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Define a coordinate system transformation with the euler angles and translation vector provided: - Euler angles: (0, 0, 0) - Translation vector: (0.015, 0.015, 0) Apply this transformation to the scaled 2D sketch, resulting in a 3D sketch. Step 5: Extrude the 3D sketch Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0825 units, using the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal parameter. This will create the final prism shape, cutting into the previous part.</description>
